headline: Trump’s new tariff threats, IPOs and FII action among 9 factors that’ll steer D-Street this week
description: Nifty weekly performance: Indian markets ended the week down 0.7%, amid sharp volatility triggered by global bond market jitters. Despite midweek sell-offs, the Nifty rebounded on Friday, led by IT and FMCG stocks. Analysts say strong DII and retail support cushioned the fall. Key upcoming triggers include India’s GDP data, U.S. budget, inflation, and jobless claims.
